\[
M = \binom{k}{n}
\]

\[
k - 2m \ge n \implies 2m \le k - n \implies m \le \frac{k - n}{2}
\]
Since \( k - n \) is even, \( \frac{k - n}{2} \) is an integer. Let \( \frac{k - n}{2} = r \). Then \( m \) can take any integer value from \( 0 \) to \( r \).

\[
\sum_{m=0}^{r} \binom{k}{2m}^2 = \frac{1}{2} \left( \sum_{m=0}^{k} \binom{k}{m}^2 + \sum_{m=0}^{k} (-1)^m \binom{k}{m}^2 \right)

\[
